net.pandoragames.far.ui.swing.component.listener

Class AbstractFileUpdaterListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • net.pandoragames.far.ui.swing.component.listener.AbstractFileOperationListener
        • net.pandoragames.far.ui.swing.component.listener.AbstractFileUpdaterListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action

    public abstract class AbstractFileUpdaterListener
extends AbstractFileOperationListener
    Extension of the AbstractFileOperationListener class for operations that modify the file data on disk.
    Author:
    Olivier Wehner
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractFileUpdaterListener

        protected AbstractFileUpdaterListener(FileSetTableModel model,
                           Localizer localizer)
        The listener is instantiated with a reference to the current FileSetTableModel and a Localizer. Error messages are written to the error property of the corresponding TargetFile object.
        Parameters:
        model - current FileSetTableModel
        localizer - for error messages

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        protected final void execute(TargetFile targetFile)
        Description copied from class: AbstractFileOperationListener
        This method will be called for every selected file from the FileSetTableModel.
        Specified by:
        execute in class AbstractFileOperationListener
        Parameters:
        targetFile - on which operations must be performed

      • executeForUpdate

        protected abstract boolean executeForUpdate(TargetFile source,
                       java.io.File target)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Called to actually perform the desired update operation. The source file is guaranteed to exist and to be writable. The modified data must be written to the supplied target file. If the method returns true, then the source file will be replaced with the target file. Otherwise the code assumes that some suitable error message has been written to the source files error property and further processing is skiped.
        Parameters:
        source - the current file
        target - where to write the updated data to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - unhandled IOExceptions are taken care of by calling code

      • success

        protected abstract void success(TargetFile targetFile)
        Called when the operation could successfully be performed. Implementing classes will typically use this method to write some information to the target files info property.
        Parameters:
        targetFile - on which the operation was successfully performed.
